instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
the board power up fine, passed apple dialogistic and can goto macOS but when goes to full CPU load after a few seconds, the board will turn off without warning.
the board had liquid damage around <CAPACITOR>C7430</CAPACITOR>. but <TRANSISTOR>Q7410</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> were really clean. the back of the board was very clean as well.
i went ahead replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7410</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> anyway in case these were affected. <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> look clean under the microscope.

any suggestion? replace all components that use <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> or could be something else unless this board is trash :( ?

[MEDIA=youtube]gd4MAQ-Wi5s[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
Test it on charger only; original Magsafe 2, 60/85W.
Also check what happens starting in SMC bypass.
Monitor temps all the time with HWMonitor.
Try other heatsink too.
And clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 51121"]Test it on charger only; original Magsafe 2, 60/85W.
Also check what happens starting in SMC bypass.
Monitor temps all the time with HWMonitor.
Try other heatsink too.
And clean ME BIOS...[/QUOTE]

same problem on smc bypass.
temp looks normal on hwmonitor
I've tried another heatsink, same problem.
i couldn't think why bios would be the problem.
probably dead pch/cpu :(

will try with charger only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message: tried with charger only and haven't crashed on prime95 but sometimes it dies during login.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
"i couldn't think why bios would be the problem."
Corrupted ME region can cause this.
Why not testing???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
i didn't think that since apple dialogistic test passed everything.

is this how you clean me region??

[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/yk2ec4P.png[/IMG]

i've downloaded MEinject tool with all the intel repository packs

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
NO.
Changing ME region with generic clean one, doesn't mean you've properly cleaned it.
Generic clean ME region is not configured for a particular board.
Medusa programmer can do the job.
If not available, you can find another way to do it on the forum.
However, if you deal with Apple machines, Medusa is a must have!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
back to this board.

just realised with a battery connected the ppbus is only 3.1v 
and ppbus is 8.6v with charger only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - shutdown when CPU usages on full load.
threads.message:
it was F7140. one side was 3v 

i will test if the board still shutdown. thanks.
